Articles.Content: What about a Mark 2 end-cap that merges flat with a surface, like the angled aerocones? The idea being to create an endpiece that radially attaches to a Mark 3 fuselage, or to a rocket (so you can radially mount the nuke engines on)
Could we by any chance also get that second inverted cockpit you made with Mekan1k's suggestion? Looks so good!!
I would really like to see T- and X-junctions for attaching Mk II parts oriented like wings.

Something like that, yeah.. Looking at them though, making them rectangular to fit in with the sides of the Mk2 might look a bit nicer (somewhat similar shape to the B9 spotlights with the cover (I can get a picture if you don't know the ones I mean), but continuing the Mk2 slope). Or something that can be slotted in line with one of the chines and not look out of place.

Idea: Literally expanded Mark 2. Split vertically down the centerline length so as to insert a flat across 1.25 meter section in between with a variety of different fillings. 

Shielded Engine Mount, double width cargo bay, retro engine system for landing, drill bay system that lowers the drill down from inside the hold, etc. Might also provide a much higher lift rating, like one of the large wings.

> 
> Since I already had the chine RCS units, I interpreted 'RCS block' as something more akin to the RV-105, but aerodynamic.

Didn't know about them - fair enough, the little blister pods would be ok as well then.
I'd like to see someone do a Mk2 Cockpit for rovers and SEVs

> 
> Edit: Though I'd try my hand at a service bay:
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/Z3GyfeO.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/Z3GyfeO.png?1)
> 
> A work in progress. the idea was to have an easily accessible compartment for stowage, with the central column holding Monoprop tanks and batteries.

Nice, but a bit big IMO. I think it should be at most half the size of a cargo bay. Actually, the Mk2 system could use some half length peices in general.

Edit: When I said cargo bay, I did mean short cargo bay.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-28T23:00:53Z" title="05/28/2015 11:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 28, 2015</time> by temporalExile**
Its currently about the size of a short cargo bay. I can make it shorter, but too short and you can't stuff much of anything into it.

Some new cockpit WIPS:

SR-71 Blackbird inspired cockpit

![WTP6OS9.png](http://i.imgur.com/WTP6OS9.png)

Cockpit inspired by '70's to '90's artist concepts of cancelled spaceplane/USAF black projects

![YVdT1ut.png](http://i.imgur.com/YVdT1ut.png)

Both still have some rough edges, but that's something to work on when I have more time.

That second cockpit looks very (VERY!!!) awesome!

That first one, the SR-71 inspired cockpit looks...less...awesome? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

No offense, but I have to agree. I'm not sure what it was that struck me when I first saw it, duck? penguin? somehow it seems too 'cute' and not quite mean enough to be an SR71... maybe the angle of the canopy? perhaps it's a little too far forward, or the part slightly too short overall?

Either way, they're both miles better than anything I could make ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

No offense taken, and thanks for the feedback. The SR-71 'pit -it does look a bit short, and the windows should probably be smaller; it will need more work before I'm satisfied with it.

I was just today wishing for a short (half-small-cargo bay) size service part. I'd take more monoprop/battery capacity over open space.

Awesome ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I was that smart guy with NTR temperature distribution. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Your NTR has too small throat-to-nozzle ratio. In other words, for your reactor and throat teh nozzle should have like 4x the diameter, and thrust should be on order of 250kN. 

I know that would make the nozzle larger than the rest of the part, so I'-m suggesting you to make it have a diameter just a little bit smaller than the center part diameter, and scale the reactor down.
So - increase size of throat and nozzle on the NTR? Shouldn't take too long.

Great work with the Shielded Mk2 docking port ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Instead why your part overeat so easily? Why you don't putt the same Max temp of other stock parts?
